sources.title: The Defiant Ones (1958) Tony Curtis · Sidney Poitier
sources.description: A white man and a black man escape from prison. They hate each other, but are chained together and must learn to overcome racial prejudice and mutual contempt. By the end of their adventure, they have almost become friends and have also realized that every sin demands atonement. A gripping, visually powerful, and excellently acted film - perhaps a little overly explicit in its moral intentions.

sources.title: The Defiant Ones (1958)
sources.description: The Defiant Ones is a 1958 American drama film produced and directed by Stanley Kramer, and stars  Tony Curtis and Sidney Poitier as two escaped prisoners,  The film was adapted by Harold Jacob Smith from the story by Nedrick Young, originally credited as Nathan E. Douglas. It  follows two escaped prisoners, Noah Cullen, an African American man, and John "Joker" Jackson, a white man, who are shackled together and must cooperate to survive while being pursued by a posse. As they navigate through difficult terrain and face various challenges, their initial animosity transforms into mutual respect and friendship.

metadata.Plot: When the truck that is transporting convicts has an accident on the road, the inmates John "Joker" Jackson and Noah Cullen that are chained to each other escape. They hate each other but they need to help each other to succeed in their intent of going north to jump in a train and reach freedom. Meanwhile the humane Sheriff Max Muller organizes a posse to track them down in a civilized manner and respecting justice. Joker and Cullen reach a small farm where a lonely woman helps them to get rid of their chains. She offers to drive her car with Joker and her son Billy while Cullen would escape through the swamp to the railroad. But when Joker learns that she sent Cullen to a trap, he leaves her and is shot in the shoulder by Billy. Joker seeks out Cullen to save him and when they meet each other, their former hatred has changed to friendship and respect.
metadata.Actors: Tony Curtis, Sidney Poitier, Cara Williams
